title: [feature request] `torch.dumps` and `torch.loads`
body_html:
So pytorch currently offers

torch.save(the_model, PATH)
the_model = torch.load(PATH)

and these are nice but a lot of standard pickling and serialization libraries feature functions dumps() and loads() (eg https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html#pickle.dumps and https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html#pickle.loads) which offer the ability to serialize the data into a bytes object instead of directly to a file. This can be handy in a number of situations, esp. if you have some other storage system that you want to utilize, or send them over the network, etc.

body:
So pytorch currently offers

```python
torch.save(the_model, PATH)
the_model = torch.load(PATH)
```

and these are nice but a lot of standard pickling and serialization libraries feature functions `dumps()` and `loads()` (eg https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html#pickle.dumps and https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html#pickle.loads) which offer the ability to serialize the data into a bytes object instead of directly to a file. This can be handy in a number of situations, esp. if you have some other storage system that you want to utilize, or send them over the network, etc.
